Yii Framework v2.0.0-dev Class Reference

Class yii\data\ModelSerializer

All Classes | Properties | Methods
Inheritanceyii\data\ModelSerializer » yii\base\Component » yii\base\Object
Implementsyii\base\Arrayable
Available since version2.0
Source Code
ModelSerializer converts a model or a list of models into an array representation with selected fields.

Used together with \yii\web\ResponseFormatter, ModelSerializer can be used to serve model data in JSON or XML format for REST APIs.

ModelSerializer provides two methods export() and exportAll() to convert model(s) into array(s). The former works for a single model, while the latter for an array of models. During conversion, it will check which fields are requested and only provide valid fields (as declared in fields() and expand()) in the array result.

Property Details

$modelClass property
string $modelClass = null

The model class that this API is serving. If not set, it will be initialized as the class of the model(s) being exported by export() or exportAll().

$context property
mixed $context = null

The context information. If not set, it will be initialized as the "user" application component. You can use the context information to conditionally control which fields can be returned for a model.

$fields property
array|string $fields = null

An array or a string of comma separated field names representing which fields should be returned. Only fields declared in fields() will be respected. If this property is empty, all fields declared in fields() will be returned.

$expand property
array|string $expand = null

An array or a string of comma separated field names representing which fields should be returned in addition to those declared in fields(). Only fields declared in expand() will be respected.

$validationErrorCode property
integer $validationErrorCode = 1024

The error code to be used in the result of exportErrors().

$validationErrorMessage property
string $validationErrorMessage = 'Validation Failed'

The error message to be used in the result of exportErrors().

$serializers property
array $serializers = []

A list of serializer classes indexed by their corresponding model classes. This property is used by createSerializer() to serialize embedded objects.

See Also

  • createSerializer()
$serializerPaths property
array $serializerPaths = ['@app/serializers']

A list of paths or path aliases specifying how to look for a serializer class given a model class. If the base name of a model class is Xyz, the corresponding serializer class being looked for would be XyzSerializer under each of the paths listed here.

$behaviors property read-only
yii\base\Behavior[] getBehaviors( )

list of behaviors attached to this component

Method Details

init() method

$model yii\base\Model The model being exported
return array the exported data

Exports a model object by converting it into an array based on the specified fields.

exportAll() method

return array the exported data

Exports an array of model objects by converting it into an array based on the specified fields.

exportErrors() method
array exportErrors( $model )
$model yii\base\Model

Exports the model validation errors.

fields() method
array fields( )
return array field name => attribute name or definition

Returns a list of fields that can be returned to end users.

These are the fields that should be returned by default when a user does not explicitly specify which fields to return for a model. If the user explicitly which fields to return, only the fields declared in this method can be returned. All other fields will be ignored.

By default, this method returns yii\base\Model::attributes(), which are the attributes defined by a model.

You may override this method to select which fields can be returned or define new fields based on model attributes.

The value returned by this method should be an array of field definitions. The array keys are the field names, and the array values are the corresponding attribute names or callbacks returning field values. If a field name is the same as the corresponding attribute name, you can use the field name without a key.

expand() method
array expand( )
return array field name => attribute name or definition

Returns a list of additional fields that can be returned to end users.

The default implementation returns an empty array. You may override this method to return a list of additional fields that can be returned to end users. Please refer to fields() on the format of the return value.

You usually override this method by returning a list of relation names.

filter() method
array filter( $data )
$data array The data being exported
return array the filtered data

Filters the data to be exported to end user.

The default implementation does nothing. You may override this method to remove certain fields from the data being exported based on the $context information. You may also use this method to add some common fields, such as class name, to the data.

getSerializer() method
static getSerializer( $modelClass )
$modelClass string Fully qualified model class name
return static the serializer

Returns the serializer for the specified model class.

createSerializer() method
yii\data\ModelSerializer createSerializer( $modelClass )
$modelClass string The model class
return yii\data\ModelSerializer the new model serializer

Creates a serializer object for the specified model class.

This method tries to create an appropriate serializer using the following algorithm:

  • Check if $serializers specifies the serializer class for the model class and create an instance of it if available;
  • Search for a class named XyzSerializer under the paths specified by $serializerPaths, where Xyz stands for the model class.
  • If both of the above two strategies fail, simply return an instance of ModelSerializer.

resolveFields() method
array resolveFields( $fields, $expand )
$fields string|array An array or a string of comma separated field names representing which fields should be returned.
$expand string|array An array or a string of comma separated field names representing which additional fields should be returned.
return array field name => field definition (attribute name or callback)

Returns the fields of the model that need to be returned to end user

exportObject() method
array exportObject( $model, $fields )
$model object The model being exported
$fields array Field definitions (field name => field definition)
return array the exported model data

Exports an object by converting it into an array based on the given field definitions.
